title: Report a concern about an attorney or deputy

details.description: Call the Office of the Public Guardian on 0115 934 2777 if you have concerns about an attorney, deputy or a decision they've made for someone else
details.body:
Call the Office of the Public Guardian on 0115 934 2777 if you have concerns about an attorney, deputy or a decision theyâ€™ve made for someone else.

You might be concerned about:

  • misuse of money or other financial matters
  • making bad decisions that affect the person they are responsible for
  • criminal activity

If you think someone is not in immediate danger but the attorney has committed a criminal offence, contact your local police force.

Call 999 if someone is in immediate danger.

tags.title: Lasting Power of Attorney, being in care and your financial affairs

details.description: Includes dealing with benefits, taxes and leaving care
Includes civil partnerships and lasting power of attorney
A Lasting Power of Attorney (LPA) lets you appoint someone to make decisions on your behalf about your finances or your health and welfare

related.title: Find out if someone has an attorney or deputy acting for them

details.description: Apply to search the Office of the Public Guardian registers to see if they have a Lasting Power of Attorney or a deputy acting on their behalf

related.title: Apply to the Court of Protection

details.description: You need to apply to the Court of Protection to act as someone's deputy and make decisions on their behalf
